intro: Paepalanthus zosterifolius, commonly known as the woolly pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and vibrant, showy inflorescences that resemble pincushions. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
